revision.comment: tweaks/corrections + remove flag from infobox per [[WP:INFOBOXFLAG]]
revision.text:
{{for|the member of the Queensland Legislative Council|William Dunstan (politician)}} {{Infobox military person |name= William Dunstan |image= William Dunstan.jpg |caption= William Dunstan VC. |birth_date= {{birth-date|8 March 1895}} |death_date= {{death-date and age|2 March 1957|8 March 1895}} |birth_place= [[Ballarat, Victoria]] |death_place= [[Toorak, Victoria]] |nickname= |allegiance= Australia |branch= [[Australian Army Reserve|Citizens Military Force]]
[[First Australian Imperial Force|Australian Imperial Force]] |serviceyears= 1914–28 |rank= [[Lieutenant]] |unit= [[7th Battalion (Australia)|7th Battalion]] |commands= |battles= [[First World War]] * [[Gallipoli Campaign]] ** [[Battle of Lone Pine]] |awards= [[Victoria Cross]]
[[Mentioned in Despatches]] |relations= [[Keith Dunstan]] (son) |laterwork= }} '''William Dunstan''', [[Victoria Cross|VC]] (2 March 1895 – 8 March 1957) was an [[List of Australian Victoria Cross recipients|Australian recipient]] of the [[Victoria Cross]], the highest award for gallantry "in the face of the enemy" that can be awarded to members of the British and [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] armed forces. ==Biography== Dunstan was born on 8 March 1895. He was 20 years old and a [[corporal]] in the [[7th Battalion (Australia)|7th Battalion]], [[First Australian Imperial Force|Australian Imperial Force]] during the [[First World War]] when he was awarded the VC for his actions on 9 August 1915, during the [[Battle of Lone Pine]] on [[Gallipoli]], Turkey. During the action Turkish forces had made a determined counter-attack on the centre of the newly captured trench held by a lieutenant, [[Frederick Harold Tubb]], two corporals ([[Alexander Stewart Burton]] and Corporal Dunstan), and a few men. The Turkish blew in the sand-bag barricade, leaving only a foot standing, but Tubb, Burton and Dunstan repelled them and rebuilt the barricade. Twice more the Turkish blew in the barricade and on each occasion they were repelled and the barricade rebuilt.{{LondonGazette|issue=29328|startpage=10154|date=15 October 1915|accessdate=12 May 2015}} Dunstan was blind for almost a year after Lone Pine. He later achieved the rank of [[lieutenant]]. Before the war, Dunstan had been a messenger boy in a draper's shop. After the war he became the general manager of [[Keith Murdoch]]'s ''[[The Herald and Weekly Times Ltd|The Herald and Weekly Times]]'' newspaper group. He died on 2 March 1957. His Victoria Cross is displayed at the [[Australian War Memorial]], [[Canberra]]. In 1995 a Memorial to Dunstan was erected in Sturt St, [[Ballarat, Victoria]], Australia. The "Dunstan VC Club" at [[Puckapunyal]] is named in his honour. He is the father of prominent journalist and writer [[Keith Dunstan]]. ==Medals== [[File:Ballarat Dunstan VC Memorial 001.JPG|thumb|right|Memorial to Dunstan in Ballarat]] Dunstan was awarded: *[[Victoria Cross]][http://cas.awm.gov.au/item/REL/03274.001 REL/03274.001 – Victoria Cross : Corporal W Dunstan, 7 Battalion, AIF], Australian War Memorial *[[1914–15 Star]][http://cas.awm.gov.au/item/REL/03274.002 REL/03274.002 – 1914–15 Star : Corporal W Dunstan, 7 Battalion, AIF], Australian War Memorial *[[British War Medal]][http://cas.awm.gov.au/item/REL/03274.003 REL/03274.003 – British War Medal 1914–20 : Corporal W Dunstan, 7 Battalion, AIF], Australian War Memorial *[[Victory Medal (United Kingdom)|Victory Medal]] with oakleaf ([[Mention in Despatches|MID]])[http://cas.awm.gov.au/item/REL/03274.004 REL/03274.004 – Victory Medal with Mention in Despatches oakleaf : Corporal W Dunstan, 7 Battalion, AIF], Australian War Memorial *[[George VI Coronation Medal]][http://cas.awm.gov.au/item/REL/03274.005 REL/03274.005 – George VI Coronation Medal : W Dunstan, VC], Australian War Memorial *[[Elizabeth II Coronation Medal]][http://cas.awm.gov.au/item/REL/03274.006 REL/03274.006 – Elizabeth II Coronation Medal : W Dunstan, VC], Australian War Memorial ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *R. P. Serle, [http://www.adb.online.anu.edu.au/biogs/A080407b.htm 'Dunstan, William (1895–1957)'], [[Australian Dictionary of Biography]], Volume 8, Melbourne University Press, 1981, pp 381–382. * {{cite web|url=http://discoveringanzacs.naa.gov.au/browse/person/33253 |title=William Dinstan – Discovering Anzacs |publisher=[[National Archives of Australia]]}} * [http://www.diggerhistory.info/pages-vc/dunstan-vc.htm William Dunstan, VC, photo, brief details] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dunstan, William}} [[Category:1895 births]] [[Category:1957 deaths]] [[Category:Australian Army officers]] [[Category:Australian Gallipoli Campaign recipients of the Victoria Cross]] [[Category:Australian newspaper publishers (people)]] [[Category:Australian World War I recipients of the Victoria Cross]] [[Category:Journalists from Melbourne]] [[Category:People from Ballarat]]
